channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tariffs 101: Here’s what they are, how they work—and who pays them
item.description: In the United States, tariffs are collected by Customs and Border Protection agents at 328 ports of entry across the country.

item.title: In Face of Trump Tariffs, Mexico Embraces Nationalism
item.description: Before the tariffs went into effect, approval ratings for President Claudia Sheinbaum rose and companies began marketing “Made in Mexico” products.

item.title: Gen Z doesn’t lack a work ethic. They’re just uninspired by today’s corporate landscape
item.description: We need to encourage what Gen Z brings, rather than ridicule a generation that’s turned off by middle management jobs.

item.title: The cost of strength: Why trust is America’s greatest asset
item.description: While holding adversaries close can serve a strategic role, holding allies even closer is a long-term necessity.

item.title: Why Is Trump Pausing Aid to Ukraine? What to Know.
item.description: The decision marked the realization of a fear that has racked Ukraine since President Trump’s re-election.

item.title: Sprawling System Brings Threat of Extreme Weather to Much of the U.S.
item.description: An “unusually strong” storm system for March may bring a range of hazards that includes wildfires, blizzards and tornadoes.

item.title: Berlin warns Chinese wind turbines planned in the North Sea pose risk of espionage and political influence
item.description: The 16 wind turbines planned near Borkum pose risks ranging from political influence, espionage via sensors to access to critical infrastructure secur...

item.title: As Gaza Crisis Deepens, Arab Leaders Are to Meet to Form a Plan
item.description: Trying to counter President Trump’s proposal to “clean out” Gaza, Arab leaders plan to meet in Cairo on Tuesday to discuss their own vision for the Pa...

item.title: Why Is Trump Pausing Aid to Ukraine? What to Know.
item.description: The decision marked the realization of a fear that has racked Ukraine since President Trump’s re-election.

item.title: Trump and Congress — in Four Speeches
item.description: On Tuesday, President Trump will address a deeply divided Congress, whose legislative authority is now being tested by his aggressive executive orders...

item.title: A Russia-Friendly Region in Bosnia Cheers Trump’s Return
item.description: Many ethnic Serbs in what was once Yugoslavia have long chafed at Washington’s foreign policy. ‘Trump’s America is different,’ said a former leader of...

item.title: Fact-Checking Trump’s Claims on Tariffs, Ukraine and DOGE Before Address to Congress
item.description: The president has repeatedly made false or misleading claims in pursuing an aggressive agenda in the first weeks of his second term.

item.title: Ukraine Races to Salvage U.S. Alliance After Trump Halts Aid
item.description: “We are working on all possible scenarios to protect Ukraine,” said President Volodymyr Zelensky, whose country was looking to European allies for sup...

item.title: Global markets tumble as Trump tariffs on Canada, Mexico, and China spark trade war fears
item.description: Growth expectations for the U.S. economy are falling as China and Canada announce their next move in the tit-for-tat trade spat with the White House.
